EN: I need to charge my mobile, the battery's nearly gone.

EN: Before the marathon one should consume a lot of carbohydrates.

EN: Stories that end badly aren't funny.

EN: The house smells nice when it's clean.

EN: Where can I deposit my valuables?

EN: That's a position that matches my profile (lit. to which my profile corresponds).

EN: when pigs fly [lit. when hens have teeth]

EN: to have one's heart beat wildly (with love)

EN: This one is the least funny.

EN: The waiter has just taken our order.

EN: You always find a slope to go sledging.

EN: In Cannes, the jury award the Golden Palm.

EN: At the refreshment station there is water and bananas.

EN: With online banking you can access your account from anywhere.

EN: People used to call me Loulou.

EN: The winner gets the gold medal.

FR: Notre chambre, qui donne sur le jardin, est très calme.
EN: Our room, which overlooks the garden, is very calm.

EN: I have taken some medicine for my stomach ache.

EN: There are deer in the clearing.

EN: Meditation is an important part of Buddhism.

EN: The best jams (fem.) are the ones I make myself.

EN: The express bus stops in front of the main entrance.

EN: I feel sick and my stomach hurts.

EN: I use lemon grass as a seasoning and as a tea.

EN: I have problems with his accent.

EN: It's a gay club, but they let heterosexuals in too.

EN: Our reunion was coincidence, but yours (formal) was planned (lit. forseen).
